[Question:]
Recommend me the top papers similar to "A non-revisiting particle swarm optimization".

[Answers:]
Based on your interest in "A non-revisiting particle swarm optimization," I found several related papers that delve into similar and advanced concepts in the field of optimization algorithms.

1. **Quantum-behaved particle swarm optimization based on solitons**: This paper introduces a variant of the quantum particle swarm optimization algorithm. It is based on the quantum concept of particle-like solitons, providing a novel approach to optimization problems【5†source】.

2. **A Quantum-Behaved Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm on Riemannian Manifolds**: This research proposes a quantum-behaved particle swarm optimization algorithm on Riemannian manifolds, named RQPSO. It is notable for its application in both differentiable and non-differentiable engineering technical problems, demonstrating versatility in solving complex optimization issues【6†source】.

3. **Non-revisiting Stochastic Search Revisited: Results, Perspectives, and Future Directions**: This paper reviews various history-driven algorithms, including history-driven scout bee ABC (HdABC) and history-driven ABC (Hd-ABC), which employ adaptive mutation strategies. These approaches show enhanced performance in solving synthetic problems and data clustering compared to traditional methods【7†source】.

These papers represent significant advancements in the field of particle swarm optimization and related algorithms, offering insights into quantum behavior, adaptation to complex manifolds, and history-driven approaches for optimization. They could provide valuable perspectives and methodologies related to your area of interest.

Check out these [search results](https://chat.openai.com/backend-api/bing/redirect?query=papers%20similar%20to%20%27A%20non-revisiting%20particle%20swarm%20optimization%27) for more details.
